firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to securely manage user accounts, products, and transactions for the Kassa Kilat application. It emphasizes authorization independence through path-based ownership for user data and segregation of data based on access requirements. User accounts are stored under `/users/{userId}`. Products, owned by each user are stored under `/users/{userId}/products/{productId}` to keep data organized per user. Transactions, also owned by a user, are located at `/users/{userId}/transactions/{transactionId}`. This design eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules, thus enhancing security and efficiency, and supports atomic operations and straightforward security rules.
